name.text: Rethinking Peer Review - An Exploration of Changing Peer Review Processes

node.summary: Join the University of Sheffield Library to examine different approaches to ‘opening up’ the process and content of peer review.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: You've Got to Fight for Your (Copy)right

node.summary: An opportunity to explore the impact of new policies on rights retention with specialists from the University Library's Copyright team.

name.text: University of Sheffield Inaugural Annual Open Research Lecture

node.summary: Speaker: Professor Tom Stafford, Senior Lecturer (Dept of Psychology) and University Research Practice Lead.

name.text: Opening the (e)Book on Open Educational Resources

node.summary: Join us to explore the possibilities for learning and teaching created by Open Educational Resources.

name.text: Climate Justice and Open Research online event

node.summary: In this session, TUoS researchers explore the value of open research practices in the response to climate challenges and inequalities.

name.text: Participants as Co-Investigators:  Opening up Research with Co-production

node.summary: Join the University of Sheffield Library for a discussion of the challenges, possibilities and power dynamics of co-produced research.
Join us on 14th-15th September 2022 to explore ideas and practice around open research in this free, interdisciplinary in-person event.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: Preprints across the disciplines

node.summary: Join the University of Sheffield Library for a discussion of how preprints are being adopted in different subjects and the effects of this.
Join us for a discussion about research metrics and how they can be used responsibly.

frontmatter.title: Visualising Cultural Heritage Data
frontmatter.description: Data visualisation for cultural heritage collections workshop presented by Dr Olivia Vane of The British Library on N8 CIR Training.

frontmatter.title: Urban Observatories hackathon
frontmatter.description: The University of Sheffield hosted a three-day hackathon aimed to begin tackling the complex challenges involved in coordinating analytics using data from urban observatories across the UK.
